inclusion.criterion: Patients >=18 years of age with pulmonary embolism and cardiogenic shock, defined as a systolic arterial pressure <= 90 mmHg, a drop in systolic arterial pressure >= 40 mmHg for >= 15 minutes, or ongoing administration of catecholamines for systemic arterial hypotension
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Subtotal or total filling defect in the left and/or right main pulmonary artery due to massive PE, as assessed by chest computed tomography or by conventional pulmonary angiography
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Systemic embolism in the presence of an arterial septal defect or patent foramen ovale.
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Life expectancy, due to underlying disease, less than one month.
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient has pulmonary embolism and cardiogenic shock, but also has systemic embolism in the presence of an arterial septal defect or patent foramen ovale.
